question: How did the AMD Data Center segment perform in Q3 2024?
ground_truth: The Data Center segment revenue reached a record $3.5 billion in Q3 2024, up 122% year-over-year, driven by strong sales of AMD Instinct GPUs and EPYC CPUs.
generated_answer:
Atomic Facts with Citations:
• Data Center GPU revenue was approximately $1.5 billion in Q3 2024 [C4]
• Data Center GPU revenue was approaching the size of AMD's compute business, which was around $1.7 billion [C6]
• AMD had a very strong quarter for the Data Center overall in Q3 and especially for the Instinct product portfolio [C5]
• AMD completed important customer milestones and ramped above initial expectations for Data Center GPU [C5]
• AMD raised full-year Data Center GPU guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion [C5]
• The guidance increase was based on completion of customer milestones [C5]
 Final Answer:
Data Center GPU Revenue: ~$1.5B (approaching compute business size of ~$1.7B) [C4][C6]
AMD delivered a very strong Data Center quarter in Q3 2024, particularly for the Instinct product portfolio [C5]. The company completed important customer milestones and ramped above initial expectations [C5]. Based on this strong performance, AMD raised its full-year Data Center GPU guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion [C5].
Specific segment margins and year-over-year/quarter-over-quarter growth rates: Not found in provided sources.

metadata.text: we had a very strong quarter for the Data Center overall in Q3 and especially for the Instinct product portfolio. We actually completed some important customer milestones, and we were able to ramp a bit above our initial expectations.\n\nSo Data Center GPU was very strong in the third quarter, and we raised overall guidance for the year from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion based on the completion of some of those customer milestones. So we feel good about the trajectory as we go through the end of this year. And then to your overall question about 2025.

"Data Center GPU vs. EPYC Growth"
      ],
      "questions": [
        "Hi, guys. Thanks for taking my question. But the first one, I wanted to go back to what you said about the size of the Data Center GPUs in the quarter. You said it was approaching the size of Your compute business which you put around what under $1.7 billion, maybe a little more.\n\nIs that right? And like if that is right, it implies that at $5 billion for the year, you'd actually be down in Q4. So I'd probably got to be $5.2 billion or $5.3 billion for the full year, just to be flat sequentially and more than that to get growth. So I guess the question is number one, is that the size of the business that you're talking about in Q3? And is that the kind of level of growth you're thinking into Q4?
